cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 395 miles south-southwest of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn northeast, cross the Florida Big Bend Thursday afternoon, accelerate across GA/SC/NC, then emerge off the Mid-Atlantic coast and continue northeastward offshore

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Anclote River to Indian Pass FL; Tropical Storm Watch: Marineland FL to Altamaha Sound GA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Anclote River to Walton/Bay County line FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of FL, then the U.S. east coast from GA through the Carolinas and offshore Mid-Atlantic/New England waters
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (7%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; most likely gusts 25–35 mph if outer bands pass inland
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Baltimore Harbor; only minor tidal anomalies possible in upper Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible late Saturday into Sunday as the storm’s moisture brushes the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief minor coastal flooding and dangerous rip currents along Maryland beaches; localized ponding on terminal roadways during heavier downpours
